snippet: OutLoud, which will begin on June 28, the 45th anniversary of the Stonewall riots in Greenwich Village, will focus on young and minority gays and those who lived before the riots.
abstract: Media Decoder column; nonprofit oral history group StoryCorps will inaugurate OutLoud, three-year project to capture experiences of young and minority gays and those who lived before the 1969 Stonewall riots; StoryCorps founder David Isay says project honors his father, psychiatrist Dr Richard Isay, who was closeted gay man for many years, but professionally is credited with helping to persuade colleagues to stop viewing homosexuality as mental illness.
lead_paragraph: OutLoud, which will begin on June 28, the 45th anniversary of the Stonewall riots in Greenwich Village, will focus on young and minority gays and those who lived before the riots.

headline.main: The Story of Gay America, via Personal Interviews
headline.print_headline: The Story of Gay America, via Personal Interviews
